document_title: Ventricular septal defect: Causes, symptoms and treatment
subsection_content:
Ventricular septal defect is a congenital malformation, but in rare cases it can be the result of some acquired damage such as after myocardial infarction, chest injury, etc. (2)
Children with the following risk factors are more likely to develop a ventricular septal defect than other children:
Be of Asian descent; Have a family history of congenital heart disease; Have genetic disorders, such as Down syndrome
